description: Design a scoreboard that compares observed output transactions to expected reference model results and flags ordering, duplication or loss.

examples.explanation: Maintain a queue of expected transactions and compare each observed transaction in-order; log mismatches and context.

constraints: Assume a single producer and consumer; timestamps may be used for ordering but be careful with out-of-order delivery due to parallelism.
hints: Keep a reference model (e.g., a simple FIFO) to derive expected outputs.
